Limit the records to those whose application are part of the Company.

Success 200.description: The total number of records that would have been returned if offset and limit were not specified. This allows for calculation of number of "pages" of data.

name: DeleteApiApplicationsId

title: Get Applications
description: Returns an array of the Applications that match the options.

permission.name:
System Admin accesses all Applications, others access
      only their own Company's Applications.

Header.description: The Create Session's returned token prepended with "Bearer "

Query Parameters.description: The maximum number of records to return. Use with offset to manage paging. 0 is the same as unspecified, returning all users that match other query parameters.
The offset into the returned database query set. Use with limit to manage paging. 0 is the same as unspecified, returning the list from the beginning.

Search the Applications based on name matches to the passed string. In the string, use "%" to match 0 or more characters and "_" to match exactly one. For example, to match names starting with "D", use the string "D%".
Limit the Applications to those belonging to the Company.
Limit the Applications to those that use the Reporting Protocol.

Success 200.description: The total number of records that would have been returned if offset and limit were not specified. This allows for calculation of number of "pages" of data.
The Id of the Company that the Application belongs to.
The base URL used by the Reporting Protocol
The Id of the Reporting Protocol used by the Application.
If the Application is currently sending data received from the Networks to the baseUrl via the Reporting Protocol.

name: GetApiApplications

description: Gets the Application record with the specified id.
title: Get Application

permission.name:
Any, but only System Admin can retrieve an Application
     that is not owned by their Company.

Header.description: The Create Session's returned token prepended with "Bearer "

Success 200.description: The Id of the Company that the Application belongs to.
The base URL used by the Reporting Protocol
The Id of the Reporting Protocol used by the Application.
If the Application is currently sending data received from the Networks to the baseUrl via the Reporting Protocol.

name: GetApiApplicationsId

description: Creates a new application record.
title: Create Application

permission.name: System Admin or Company Admin

Header.description: The Create Session's returned token prepended with "Bearer "

Request Body.description: The Application's name
The Application's description
The Id of the Company that the Application blongs to. For a Company Admin user, this can only be the Id of their own Company.
The URL that the Reporting Protocol sends the data to. This may have additional paths added, depending on the Reporting Protocol.
The Id of the Reporting Protocol the Application will use to pass Device data back to the Application Vendor.

examples.title: Example body:
examples.content:
{
    "name": "GPS Pet Tracker",
    "description": "Pet finder with occasional reporting",
    "companyId": J59j3Ddteoi8,
    "baseUrl": "https://IoTStuff.com/incomingData/GPSPetTracker"
    "reportingProtocolId": 6s3oi3j90ed9j
}

name: PostApiApplications

title: Import Devices

List of device import data. devEUI required.

name: GetApiNetworks

description: Gets the Network record with the specified id.
title: Get Network

permission.name:
Any logged-in user, but only System Admins receive the
     networkSecurity field.

Header.description: The Create Session's returned token prepended with "Bearer "

Success 200.description: The Id of the Network Provider that provides the Network.
The Id of the Network Type that the Network uses.
The Id of the Network Protocol that the Network uses.
The base URL used by the Network Protocol to reach the Network's API server.
The data used to grant secure access to the Network's server API. (Only returned to System Admins.)

name: GetApiNetworksId

description: Creates a new Network record.
title: Create Network

permission.name: System Admin.

Header.description: The Create Session's returned token prepended with "Bearer "

Request Body.description: The Network's name
The Id of the Network Provider that provides the Network.
The Id of the Network Type that the Network uses.
The Id of the Network Protocol that the Network uses.
The base URL used by the Network Protocol to reach the Network's API server.
The data used to grant secure access to the Network's server API. This data is defined by the Network Type.

name: PostApiNetworks

description: Updates the Network record with the specified id.
title: Update Network

permission.name: System Admin

Header.description: The Create Session's returned token prepended with "Bearer "

Request Body.description: The Network's name
The Id of the Network Provider that provides the Network.
The Id of the Network Type that the Network uses.
The Id of the Network Protocol that the Network uses.
The base URL used by the Network Protocol to reach the Network's API server.
The data used to grant secure access to the Network's server API. This data is defined by the Network Type.

name: PutApiNetworksId

description: Deletes the Password Policy record with the specified id.
title: Delete Password Policy

permission.name:
System Admin, or Company Admin for the Password Policy's
    company.

Header.description: The Create Session's returned token prepended with "Bearer "

name: DeleteApiPasswordpoliciesId

description: Gets the password policy records for the company. All returned records' ruleRegExp fields must "match" an entered password for it to be considered valid for the company.
title: Get Company Password Policies

permission.name: Any logged-in user.

Header.description: The Create Session's returned token prepended with "Bearer "

URL Parameters.description: The Company's id for which to retrieve the Password Policies.

Success 200.description: The Password Policy's description, intended for display to the end user.
The Password Policy's Javascript regular expression, which must "match" the entered password for it to be considered valid.
True indicates a system-wide rule, which can only be changed by a System Admin.

name: GetApiPasswordpoliciesCompanyCompanyid

description: Gets the Password Policy record with the specified id.
title: Get Password Policy

permission.name:
Any logged-in user can get their own company's Password
    Policies or global Password Policies.  System Admin can get any
    Password Policy.

Header.description: The Create Session's returned token prepended with "Bearer "

Success 200.description: The Password Policy's description, intended for display to the end user.
The Password Policy's Javascript regular expression, which must "match" the entered password for it to be considered valid.
The company who owns this Password Policy or null if a global policy.

name: GetApiPasswordpoliciesId

description: Creates a new Password Policy record.
title: Create Password Policy

permission.name:
System Admin can create a Password Policy for any Company
     or a global Password Policy (no companyId).  A Company Admin can
     create Password Policies for their own company only.

Header.description: The Create Session's returned token prepended with "Bearer "

Request Body.description: The Password Policy's description, intended for display to the end user.
The Password Policy's Javascript regular expression, which must "match" the entered password for it to be considered valid.

The id of the company that this Password Policy belongs to. If not supplied, for a System Admin, defaults to null (global rule for all users/companies). For Company Admin, defaults to the user's companyId. If specified by a Company Admin, it MUST match their own company.

name: PostApiPasswordpolicies

description: Updates the Password Policy record with the specified id.
title: Update Password Policy

permission.name: System Admin, or Company Admin for the Password Policy's *       Company.

Header.description: The Create Session's returned token prepended with "Bearer "

Request Body.description: The Password Policy's description, intended for display to the end user.
The Password Policy's Javascript regular expression, which must "match" the entered password for it to be considered valid.
The id of the company that this Password Policy belongs to. Can only be specified by a System Admin.

name: PutApiPasswordpoliciesId

permission.name: Any logged-in user.

Header.description: The Create Session's returned token prepended with "Bearer "

Success 200.description: The Reporting Protocol code that communicates with an Application vendor's server.

title: Create Reporting Protocol

permission.name: System Admin

Request Body.description: The Reporting Protocol's name
The Reporting Protocol code that communicates with an Application vendor's server.

title: Delete Session
description: Deletes the session.
name: DeleteApiSessions

title: Create Session
description: Returns a JWT token in the response body that the caller is to put into the Authorize header, prepended with "Bearer ", for any authorized access to other REST interfaces.
name: PostApiSessions

description: Deletes the User record with the specified id.
title: Delete User

permission.name:
System Admin, or Company Admin for this company, though
     the caller cannot delete their own record.

Header.description: The Create Session's returned token prepended with "Bearer "

name: DeleteApiApplicationsId

title: Get Users
description: Returns an array of the Users that match the options.

permission.name:
System Admin accesses all Users, Company Admin access
      only their own Company's Users.

Header.description: The Create Session's returned token prepended with "Bearer "

Query Parameters.description: The maximum number of records to return. Use with offset to manage paging. 0 is the same as unspecified, returning all users that match other query parameters.
The offset into the returned database query set. Use with limit to manage paging. 0 is the same as unspecified, returning the list from the beginning.

Search the Users based on username matches to the passed string. In the string, use "%" to match 0 or more characters and "_" to match exactly one. For example, to match names starting with "D", use the string "D%".
Limit the Users to those belonging to the Company.

Success 200.description: The total number of records that would have been returned if offset and limit were not specified. This allows for calculation of number of "pages" of data.
The Id of the Company that the User belongs to.

name: GetApiUsers

description: Gets the User record with the specified id.
title: Get User

permission.name: Any logged-in user.  System Admin's

Header.description: The Create Session's returned token prepended with "Bearer "

Success 200.description: The Id of the Company that the User belongs to.

name: GetApiUsersId

description: Gets the User record for the logged-in user based on the Authorization header.
title: Get User "Me"

permission.name: Any logged-in user.

Header.description: The Create Session's returned token prepended with "Bearer "

Success 200.description: The Id of the Company that the User belongs to.

name: GetApiUsersMe

description: Creates a new User record.
title: Create User

permission.name:
System Admin, or Company Admin can create new Users for
     their own Company.

Header.description: The Create Session's returned token prepended with "Bearer "

Request Body.description: The User's username
The User's email (required for Admin users)
The User's role in the system.
The Id of the Company that the User belongs to.

name: PostApiUsers

description: Updates the User record with the specified id.
title: Update User

permission.name:
System Admin, or Company Admin for this Company (cannot
     change companyId), or any logged-in User on their own record (cannot
     change companyId or role).

Header.description: The Create Session's returned token prepended with "Bearer "

Request Body.description: The User's username
The User's email
The User's role in the system. (System or Company Admin only)
The Id of the Company that the User belongs to. (System Admin only)

name: PutApiUsersId

description: Verifies/rejects a user's email change
title: Verify User Email

permission.name: Any

URL Parameters.description: The UUID supplied via email to the email address.

Query Parameters.description: The action to take on the requested email change
Where the email verification originated.

name: PutApiUsersVerifyemailUuid
